page.title: 03Housing in Scunthorpe
page.content: Our square kilometre (0489 0409) is a largely residential area with very few shops or public buildings. The housing is varied, by far the largest proportion is of the semi detached type. At the centre is the village of{Old {Brumby}with a cluster of cottages from the early 19th Century, mostly converted into modern homes. Further development at the beginning of the century on the Gainsborough road enlarged the village and the next housing phase was in the 1920s and 1930s along Ashby and Cemetery roads. At this time the new bypass, the {Queensway,}was built crossing land owned by{Brumby Farm.}Since the population explosion after the war the rest of the farm was taken over.
